author: @ConcernedCitizen_99
content: URGENT: Is anyone else receiving texts about a 'Gold Rewards' expiry? üõë I just got an SMS claiming my loyalty points will vanish in 24 hours unless I redeem them immediately at 'mashreq-rewards-portal-update.com'. The landing page looks frighteningly legitimate‚Äîit has the exact branding, fonts, and even a copyright footer. It asks for card details to 'verify' shipping for the rewards. I almost filled it out before hesitating. #ScamAlert #BankingSecurity #Phishing

comments.comment: Wait, I just got that too! I clicked the link because it looked official. Should I be worried?
@FastClicker Call your bank immediately and freeze your cards. Banks NEVER send links like that.
Oh god. On hold with them now. The site asked for my OTP to 'verify' the points. I entered it. üò∞
This is everywhere today. My mom got the same message but from a different number.
These scammers are getting too good. The URL is barely different. Check the SSL certificate next time guys.
Why isn't the bank posting about this?? They should have sent a warning notification by now if it's this widespread!
@AngryUser_X They usually do, give them a minute. It's Sunday.
Scammers don't take Sundays off @ChillGuy22. My friend lost 5000 AED last month to a similar thing.
Does anyone know the official SMS header the bank uses? Mine came from a random mobile number.
@NewbieBanker Official messages usually show the Bank Name as the sender, not a number. Block and report it.
I almost fell for it. The landing page had the exact logo and font. Scarily accurate.
My uncle just called me panic-stricken. He gave them his CVV. Helping him block the card now.
@DailyRant Make sure he changes his app password too, not just the card.
Is this affecting only one bank or multiple? I saw a similar post about another bank yesterday.
Rumor has it a third-party marketing vendor got hacked. That's how they have our numbers.
@InsiderInfo Do you have a source for that? Or just spreading panic?
@FactChecker Just what I heard on Reddit. But it explains why the texts are so targeted.
I'm removing my money. This feels unsafe.
@ScaredCustomer Relax. Phishing isn't a bank hack. It's social engineering. Your money is fine if you don't click fake links.
@RationalRick Easy for you to say. I'm not taking chances.
Reporting the domain to Google Safe Browsing right now. Everyone should do the same.
Guys, the link is down now. Looks like it's been taken offline.
Update: Bank blocked the transaction in time! They said their fraud detection caught it. Phew. üòÖ
@FastClicker That's great news! See @AngryUser_X, the system works.
Still think they should have tweeted a warning earlier.
This is a classic 'Urgency' tactic. 'Expiring in 24 hours' shuts down critical thinking.
I didn't even get the text. Feeling left out of the scam party lol.
My grandmother just asked me about this. These people target the elderly specifically. Disgusting.
Can we pin this post or something? People need to see the URL.
Rule #1: If you get a text about your account, open the official app directly. Never click links.
I got a call claiming to be from the fraud department asking if I received this text. Was that real??
@ConfusedUser Did they ask for your PIN or password? If yes, SCAM. If they just alerted you, might be real.
@SecurityHawk They asked me to confirm my date of birth. I hung up.
@ConfusedUser Good call. Better safe than sorry. Call the number on the back of your card to check.
Stay safe everyone. The digital world is a minefield today.
Just saw this. Blocking that number now.
We are tracking these reports. Please forward suspicious SMS to the official fraud email.
Tomorrow it will be a different link. Education is the only defense.

author: @Investigator_Doe
content: Has anyone else seen this 'Official Investment Bot' ad on social media featuring the Bank's CEO? ü§ñ It claims guaranteed 40% returns if you download a specific app. The video looks slightly off‚Äîthe lip sync is lagging. Pretty sure it's a deepfake, but my dad is convinced it's real because 'the CEO said it.' This is getting dangerous.

comments.comment: 100% a deepfake. I saw the same video but with a different celebrity last week.
It's terrifying how real the voice sounds though. We need an official denial ASAP.
Report the ad to the platform immediately. Banks never guarantee returns like that.

author: @DigitalNomad_User
content: Getting WhatsApp messages from a 'Bank Support Agent' with a verified checkmark (in the profile pic, not the actual badge). They are saying a large international transfer was flagged and I need to verify my identity via a video call. Is the bank using WhatsApp for official compliance checks now? Seems sketchy. ü§®

comments.comment: Absolutely not. No bank conducts compliance checks via WhatsApp video calls. Block them.
Thought so. They were very aggressive when I asked for an email confirmation.
They record your face in the video call to use for biometric bypasses on other apps. Be careful!

author: @SecureBankingAlerts
content: SECURITY ALERT: We are receiving reports of callers impersonating bank staff claiming your 'KYC is pending' or 'Account Suspended' to steal OTPs. üö´ The callers often use fear tactics to pressure you into acting fast. Remember: Bank staff will NEVER ask for your OTP, PIN, or Password over the phone. If you are unsure, hang up and call the number on the back of your card.

comments.comment: I wish I saw this yesterday. They sounded so professional, even had my name right.
Thanks for the reminder. I've told my parents to ignore unknown numbers.
Is there a way to report these numbers directly in the app?

author: @BankOfficial
content: CLARIFICATION: We are NOT running a 'Gold Rewards Points Expiry' campaign via SMS. ‚ùå Any message containing links to 'mashreq-rewards-update.com' or similar variations is fraudulent. Do not click these links or enter your card details. We are working with authorities to take down these phishing sites. Please conduct all reward redemptions strictly through our official mobile app.

comments.comment: Thank you for the official statement! Sharing this with my family group chat.
Finally! This should have been posted yesterday when the texts started going out.
Good swift action. The phishing site seems to be down already.

author: @BankSupport
